meanings.definition: A small bundle or cluster, especially of nerve or muscle fibers.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the fascicules in the body help transmit signals.
meanings.sent2: The microscope revealed the intricate fascicules of nerves in the tissue sample.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten chased its tail, imagining it was a fascicule of yarn.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the branches intertwined like fascicules of a giant nerve network.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the vibrant fascicules of colors blending together.

meanings.definition: A section or installment of a book or publication, typically part of a larger series.
meanings.sent1: The library received the latest fascicules of the encyclopedia series.
meanings.sent2: Each fascicule of the magazine contained different articles on gardening.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, the student hid a fake spider in the fascicule of the library book.
meanings.sent4: The detective carefully examined each fascicule of the mystery novel for clues.
meanings.sent5: The teacher handed out the fascicules of the textbook for the upcoming lesson.
